comment: Chill professor. Only quizzes and discussion every week and one semester paper. Video
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Pop quizzes weekly! If u miss a quiz or a test for whatever reason (I was sick), it doesn't matter and it's an automatic 0. There are 3 tests that contain 100 questions, way too much. 6 quizzes that are all timed for 7 mins. If you show up 4 mins late on quiz day, you only get 3 mins to complete it. Strict for no reason. Would not take him again.

Overall, a great professor who knows his stuff. He is super chill and very nice. Throughout the semester, he shared lots of interesting stories. I find he is willing to work with students if there are any conflicts. If you take good notes and study, then you will do fine in this class.

Dr. McCafferty was very knowledgeable in the subject. Though, at times his class was rather disorganized. His tests consisted of a mix of the text book and lectures and always 100 questions, his quizzes were also only 10 questions but were very broad. Just do your reading and attend class, and you're guaranteed to succeed.
Not too much work in this class, his powerpoints are very useful and tests aren't hard as long as you listen and study. Super nice guy. Definitely take notes!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Fun class. I enjoyed his lectures even though they got really lengthy sometimes. We had a couple of discussion boards, 3 tests (incl a final that wasn't cumulative), and roughly 2 pop quizzes between each test (got automatic 100s for the ones he didn't get to). Study on Quizlet, take good notes, or skim the book and you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. McCafferty was a funny guy and his jokes made the lectures enjoyable! We had pop quizzes but I believe they prepared you for the tests better. He allows you to miss 3 classes and then starts taking points off. However, if you miss three or less, he gives extra credit!!! This bumped my grade up to an A!! I would recommend this class to everyone!

Dr. McCafferty's personality really made this class enjoyable. He posted all of the notes for us to access later and he was accessible outside of class. There are some pop quizzes but I believe that they help prepare you for the tests. This was a great class and I really learned a lot.

Dr. McCafferty and his AI's were great this semester. The material was straight-forward, and the instructors keep students well-informed of what to expect in the course. Lectures are an appropriate length and as long as you read the material, you can pass the tests. Review sessions were recorded live for review later. Grading did not take long.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall a pretty easy class. Took it over the summer online and sometimes, I'd even forget that I was taking it because imo, the workload was pretty fair compared to my other classes. Reading the textbook is a must because he will quiz you on statistical data from the book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: As someone who withdrew from this class before, I would recommend taking this class with him online. There are weekly quizzes that are super easy if you watch the lectures, a couple of assignments that require no effort, a midterm and final that requires lockdown, and a 3 part final paper. The midterm & 2nd part of the final are the hardest things

Took Professor McCafferty for Corrections online and now Research Methods and hes been the one of the best teachers Ive had at Kennesaw. He does require attendance but its only for your gain based on the lecture material you need to know. Hes understanding and caring for his students, and he knows the material while bringing in own experiences

He started off the year basically admitting that this was going to be a difficult course and that he "knows nobody would be taking the class unless it was required. There are only 6 assignments, one or two quizzes, a research paper, a midterm, and a two-part exam. Doesn't answer emails. VERY lecture heavy. HARD grader. This will be my first C ever.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Best professor I've had at KSU! Lectures aren't just him reading slides word for word like most others. He has experience in the field and teaches. Wish all of my professors were like him!

Dr. McCafferty was a great online professor. His lectures were interesting and he's willing to work with students if you communicate. The class is graded off of chapter quizzes, three short discussion posts, and three exams. He drops your lowest quiz grade and provided an extra credit discussion post. Fairly easy class, really nice guy.

He's the man. I've had him for 3 classes and am trying to get him for the 4th time. He really cares about his students and offers extra credit. I hate doing online, but he made it interesting through his lectures. The summer class is 2 discussion posts a week, a midterm, a research paper, and a final. Everything you need is in the lectures.

Not the best professor, I had him last year for an in-person class during Spring 2020 and he seemed pretty great at that time. I decided to take him again this semester (online) and he's been horrible. Lacks communication with students (no emails back), uploads study guide late, horrible attitude, tells us he's on our side when he's clearly not.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Prof. was okay, just hated the AI's. They were so inconsistent. Some students got good grades on the same thing you got penalized on. I wish everything was marked by the professor only. I got Alex and she was horrible with grading but prof chose to side with her when you complain. I hope KSU can change this.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. McCafferty was great, and so were the AI's that help grade but beware of Alex Goldstein, if you get her, better request for change or ensure your work is perfect. Never misspell, miss covering every topic discussed & must cite/paragraph. Be ready to readite 3-4 articles/wk. (10pgs each) & this is just on discussions. There's assgmnts & exams
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: McCafferty is very unorganized, doesn't respond to student emails, and doesn't return grades in a timely manner. He had trouble communicating with our class regarding technical issues when posting assignments. I felt as if the lectures were long and drawn out. The exams are relatively easy. It's a pretty easy class to pass, but he's not great.

Class isn't too hard but this professor does not respond to emails. As it is an online class, email is the only way to get clarification on things. I got sick during midterms & he still hasn't responded to my emails 2 months later. Even got the department chair involved. Its finals week & I still don't know if I am able to take my midterm.

So let me start off by saying this man is horrible idk who gives his good reviews but he does not upload power points to study, grabs random info from book and quizzes. Midterm he gave us a study guide which we tested on another subject. instead of 2 hours we got 1:30. His essay questions are at then end and expects 3 paragraphs. DO NOT TAKE! RUNN!

I love him already. I am not finished with his class, but I am sure I will receive an A. He truly cares about his students and their success in his class and their future careers. I recommend him 100% He doesnt hesitate to help in any way. This pandemic has been stressful, but having him as a professor makes this class so much easier!

He is a great professor and tells lots of stories that connect to the lesson to keep class interesting (he used to be a parole officer so he has lots of stories). You do have a textbook for this class but I only skimmed through and did the review questions at the end of each chapter and that was enough for me.

By far one of the best professors I have had in college. He also incorporates his experiences during the lectures as well which are quite funny. If you attend each class, take notes, and skim over the textbook, you will do just fine. I would totally love to take him again if I have to take another CJ class.

Dr. McCafferty uses his real-life experiences when lecturing in the class. He also likes to make sure that everyone is participating. If you don't pay attention in class or skip a lot you will fail. There are 3 tests but other grades weigh in on your final grade.

He's a great professor and really cares about what he does. He wants you to learn and he isn't a difficult professor at all. It's always a fun time in his class and he always has good stories. 7 quizzes, 3 tests, but they're SUPER easy! Just read the book and study the lectures/powerpoints.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really cool guy. Down to earth and has some funny anecdotes. His way of teaching was nice, show up and make sure to write things down and you will do well on the tests. Would def. take him again.

3332 Corrections. 3 test 52 questions, a 5 page paper & a non cumulative final. Hes straight forward. Gives study guides. PowerPoints posted a few days before the exam so, take notes in class. Study! Pay attention. Stuff on the exam is stated in class via lectures. I finished with a B. If I studied for the exams more, wouldve been an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Walked into class two minutes late first day and he glared at me while opening the door. Give it a couple months and he's my favorite teacher of the semester. He makes you work but he's very clear and I learned a lot from him. Attendance was a little strict for an 8 am class though, which is my only gripe.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. McCaffery is very straight forward with what he expects of each students. For this to be one of the difficult classes he made it quite simple because he wants each student to be successful. Show up to class & take notes because he does not and will not post his pp's. He gives plenty of handouts and examples. Possible to end with a B, even an A
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved Dr. McCafferty for this course. He was very willing to help if you had a problem. He wanted to make sure that everyone understood the material. He was also pretty funny. TAKE HIS CLASS FOR THIS COURSE!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor McCafferty is one of those professors that one the first day of class he is strict and tells you exactly what the class is about. He may seem like a jerk but he is one of the best professors I have ever taken. He will tell you exactly what he wants on assignments, and will actually help you if you need it. Overal a great professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took Professor McCafferty for Research Methods. He is amazing! Takes attendance every day and tests are straight from the notes. There is also a research paper and several quizzes which he gives you time to prepare for. He understands that the topic is boring but he will give you everything you need to make an A in the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is my second time taking Dr. McCafferty, and I would not recommend this professor especially in the summer. He is passionate about the subject but the class is a lot of work. The readings he assigns weekly consists of 40-50 pages on average along with weekly discussion posts and quizzes. The class in the summer is double this amount.

As a non-criminal justice major, I was worried about this class originally, but excited to take it. Dr. McCafferty was my favorite professor of Freshman year. He has great lectures. 2 papers, 4 quizzes & 3 tests.(all are straightforward and easy) Attendance is mandatory, but the notes are easy to follow and the class is fun. Would highly recommend!

Research Methods. The class is boring boring by itself, that's not his fault. Remember you need it to graduate. He lectures a lot, but this is to ensure that you understand the material. His tests are not hard if you study for them. You have a midterm, a paper (in 3 parts) and a final. Attendance is mandatory. I made an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. McCafferty was one of my favorite professors! While the class in lecture heavy he makes it fun! He tells funny stories and really makes the class feel like their opinion matters, and thats a lot coming from someone like me who is usually quiet and shy! Goes over whats on test. Has a few 10 question quizzes. Can't wait to take him again!

Not a whole lot of outside work. Take good notes during lectures, and you'll be fine. Professor M is really funny and knows what he's talking about in CJ. I'm a CJ major so I found this stuff super interesting, but I think others majors did too.

Tough grader. Majority of Corrections class received between a 30 and a 70 on his exams. It's funny because on the very first day he said I am not the type of professor that gets a kick off of how difficult my exams are, ironically he is exactly what he said he wasn't. I will never take him again. I do not recommend f2f. Heard his online better.

Dr. M is really helpful. You have to write one pager but it isn't bad. You take test frequently but all the material is covered. Lectures are very clear. He like to use personal references that I find to be helpful. I would definitely take it again.

i took him for both intro to CJ and Corrections and i love him, hes a really easy going guy but still kind of strict about the subject. he knows what hes talking about and is passionate about it. GO TO CLASS. i probably would have gotten a B if i had missed any classes but he gives extra credit to those who go to every class
Mr. McCafferty is a cool guy. He is realistic and puts things bluntly. Gives pop quizzes. Must study for tests. But do what you need to do and you'll do well.

I took Dr. M for CJRU Research Methods. The content was 100% boring, which he was upfront about & the research paper was fairly intense. Dr. M is great on communication whether it be via email or office hours. He makes it clear that if you want to succeed he will help you do so. Passable course, though it requires great effort & a lot of studying!

McCafferty is great, but RM is tough. Class is spent copying slides. Exams are straightforward from only notes. Grade was 20% midterm, 25% final, 30% class assignments, & 5% attendance, and finally a research paper completed in 3 steps: 3% writing 1-2pg abstract, 10% writing a 7-8pg literature review, then 7% 3-4pg conclusion. No book required.

I loved this professor. Take McCafferty if you want to learn from someone that knows his stuff and is experienced in the field. 3 tests, one research paper, and one presentation make up his class. He genuinely takes interests in all of his students. Can't say enough good.

He is my favorite by far. The class is SO interesting and he makes it better. He is extremely clear and makes class fun. Jokes around with students, but still covers everything in a timely manner. If you take notes and pay attention you'll get an A. He is super fair and really helpful. I absolutely love him, I 100% recommend, Take him FOR SURE!

He's a nice guy.  Very boring teacher though.  Dry/boring material. Mid term & final, 3 papers, class assignments no extra credit.  Don't bother buying the book he tests on his material.  I got an A studying from notes taken from his slides.

He is a great guy but a very boring teacher. All he does is click through power points and its a bit hard to understand. You do A LOT of note taking. But, he drops the lowest quiz grade and is willing to work with you if you put in the effort.

Loved his class. Easy teacher. Will work with and drops your lowest quiz grade. He knows what he is talking about and at the end of the semester you will know it as well. Great teacher and he is funny.

Excellent professor, would definitely recommend. If criminal justice interests you, take him. I thought the class was great. Mandatory attendance and quizzes are announced the class before. Class is not difficult at all. 2 multiple choice quizzes before the exam. 3 exams. Noncumulative final. Quiz questions are on the exams. 2 writing assignments.
Arrogant. Doesn't like the south. Hard on papers. Very few opportunities

Mr. McCafferty has a rough attitude. He is always helpful though. Very willing to urther explain stuff you don't understand. His class is on the points system, so there is little room for error. I was one point away from a "B" and he wouldn't bump me. (You get the grade you earned!)

He was a great professor. He was very respectful of everyone in class. Never rude in any way. The subject matter is boring to those that have little or no interest in it. As long as you go to class, listen, and read what he tells you to read you will do well in the class. He is very knowledgeable about courts and corrections.

I did very well in his class but it was extremely boring.  He is tough on papers like others said and he can be arrogant and dismissive so the comment that those who feel that way didn't do well is not true.  He gives a lot of outside readings which equate to another textbook in pages exams are multiple choice and essays on the outside readings.
As long as you follow directions and take a few notes, his classes are fine.

As everyone said, he is very boring.  Doesn't post notes so you have to write through his lectures and learn nothing. Little room for error with 2 tests and one paper. Grades extremely hard on papers, get an English major to help you!

I don't know what these people are talking about. Mr. McCafferty is a great teacher! He's not disrespectful to anyone. He lets you give your opinion and the worst you'll get is "not exactly." The people that don't like him didn't do well and are just pissy about it.

I had him for research methods. The class material is boring but its not his fault. Overall the class requires a lot of work, but if you do it you will pass. Midterm and a Final, 2 research papers, and weekly online quizzes make up your grade. He counts attendance as well. Not my first choice, but i would take  his class again.

only a midterm and final, not hard, but need to study; 2 essays on the exams. attendance every day. class is BORING!!! write 2 papers, one three pg and one five page. He grades very hard on these. He assigns you the research topic and find eight peer reviewed sources and after, debate on your topic. VERY DIFFICULT to get a good grade on papers!

His class is not that difficult. He makes sure his students has the notes before he changes the slides. He enjoys facilitating discussions and is open to everyone's opinions. He has two tests, two papers, and a debate at the end of the semester. His class does get boring because he lectures a lot.

He is new to KSU and GA.  He is arrogant and talks down to you.  Doesn't like you to disagree with him, just shut up and listen.  Doesn't post powerpoint or use GAView.  you have to take notes and feel like you are so hurried to take notes that you aren't getting anything out of his boring lectures.  Take another professor.
Waste of time and money!  You are better off teaching yourself!
